channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Judge puts a one-year limit on Google's contracts for default search placement
item.description: A federal judge has expanded on the remedies decided for the Department of Justice's antitrust case against Google, ruling in favor of putting a one-year limit on the contracts that make Google's search and AI services the default on devices, Bloomberg reports. Judge Amit Mehta's ruling on Friday means Google will have to renegotiate these contacts every year, which would create a fairer playing field for its competitors. The new details come after Mehta ruled in September that Google would not have to sell off Chrome, as the DOJ proposed at the end of 2024. This all follows the ruling last fa...

item.title: This Chinese chip giant is boosting production to try and take on Nvidia - but how will Huawei feel?
item.description: Cambricon aims to triple AI chip output in 2026 despite yield issues, resource shortages, and rising competition from Huawei.

item.title: Meta reportedly delays mixed reality glasses until 2027
item.description: aMeta lready sells VR headsets and Ray-Ban smart glasses, but these new glasses sound a bit different. Their format factor would reportedly be similar to the Apple Vision Pro, with a puck-like power source.

item.title: The Extended ‘Lord of the Rings’ Trilogy Comes Back to Theaters
item.description: Celebrate the 25th anniversary of the first 'Lord of the Rings' by watching the longer versions of the trilogy in theaters next month.

item.title: Apple Is Hemorrhaging Vice Presidents
item.description: Amid rumors that Tim Cook may leave soon, many of his direct reports are retiring or otherwise moving on.
